terms.definition: Product Requirements Document - an internal document that defines what a product should accomplish for users without specifying implementation details, used to align development teams with business requirements
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides self-service answers to user questions and solutions to problems
A support model where customers can find answers and resolve issues independently using documentation, FAQs, and other resources without contacting support staff
Written materials that explain how to use, install, configure, or develop technical products, typically including user guides, API docs, and setup instructions
The visual elements and interactive components of a software application that users interact with, including buttons, menus, and screens
Keep It Simple, Stupid - a design principle emphasizing that systems work best when kept simple rather than made complicated
Unique Selling Points - distinctive features or benefits that differentiate a product from competitors and provide value to customers
A lightweight markup language that uses plain text formatting syntax to create structured documents, commonly used for documentation and web content
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing teams to collaborate and maintain different versions of content
Search Engine Optimization - the practice of optimizing content and websites to improve visibility and ranking in search engine results
Enhanced search results that display additional information like ratings, images, or structured data to make listings more prominent in search engines
The process of adapting content for different languages, cultures, and regions to make it relevant and accessible to global audiences
The consistent personality and style of communication used in written content that reflects a brand's character and values
Fictional characters created to represent different user types and their needs, behaviors, and goals, used to guide content and product decisions
The overall perception and interaction a customer has with a company throughout their entire journey, from awareness to post-purchase support
